member.name: N:Xceed.UI
member.summary: This namespace is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.IKeyboardHandling
member.summary: Interface which defines what keys and characters are accepted as input keys and characters.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.IKeyboardHandling.IsInputChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines if a character is an input character that the editor recognizes.
member.returns: true if the character should be sent directly to the editor and not preprocessed; false otherwise.
member.param: The character to test.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.IKeyboardHandling.IsInputKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.
member.returns: true if the specified key is a regular input key; false otherwise.
member.param: One of the Keys values.

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.IThemed
member.summary: Interface which indicates that the implementing control supports theming.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.IThemed.ResetUIStyle
member.summary: Resets the value of the UIStyle property to its default value.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.IThemed.Theme
member.summary: This property is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.IThemed.UIStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the control/editor.
member.remarks: When set to WindowsXP on non-Windows XP machines, the blue XP theme style will be used. On Windows XP machines, the current theme will be used. If you want to force a style in particular, for example the Blue, Olive Green or Silver XP themes, the resource assembly must be assigned to the ResourceAssembly property and the UIStyle property set to UIStyle.ResourceAssembly.

member.name: E:Xceed.UI.IThemed.UIStyleChanged
member.summary: Raised when the value of the UIStyle property is changed.

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.GradientMode
member.summary: A value representing the orientation of the gradient axis.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: The orientation of the gradient axis is horizontal: colors are graded from left to right.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: The orientation of the gradient axis is vertical: colors are graded from top to bottom. (Default value.)

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.GripLocation
member.summary: Value representing the location of the resizing control/form when it is dock-filled on a form.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GripLocation.None
member.summary: No resizing grip is displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GripLocation.TopLeft
member.summary: The resizing grip is located in the top-left corner.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GripLocation.TopRight
member.summary: The resizing grip is located in the top-right corner.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GripLocation.BottomLeft
member.summary: The resizing grip is located in the bottom-left corner.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.GripLocation.BottomRight
member.summary: The resizing grip is located in the bottom-right corner.

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.ImageStyle
member.summary: Value indicating the style in which an image is displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.ImageStyle.Stretch
member.summary: The image is stretched to fit the available area.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.ImageStyle.Tile
member.summary: The image is repeated until the entire available area is filled.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.ImageStyle.Align
member.summary: The image is aligned according to the value of the control's BackgroundImageAlignment property

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.UIStyle
member.summary: Value representing the appearance of a control and its child elements.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.UIStyle.System
member.summary: The control and its child elements will have the system's theme appearance.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.UIStyle.WindowsClassic
member.summary: The control and its child elements will have the classic Windows 95 to 2000 appearance.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.UIStyle.WindowsXP
member.summary: The control and its child elements will have the Windows XP appearance.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.UIStyle.ResourceAssembly
member.summary: The control and its child elements will have the appearance defined in the resource assembly which can be provided by setting the control's ResourceAssembly property.

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.Margins
member.summary: A structure representing margins.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Margins structure.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Margins structure.
member.param: A value representing the width, in pixels, of the left, top, right and bottom margins.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Margins structure.
member.param: The width, in pixels, of the left margin.
The width, in pixels, of the right margin.
The height, in pixels, of the top margin.
The height, in pixels, of the bottom margin.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.Add(Xceed.UI.Margins)
member.summary: Adds the specified margins to the current Margins structure.
member.param: A Margins structure representing the margins to add to the current Margins structure.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Tests whether the specified object is a Margins structure and is equivalent to this Margins structure.
member.returns: true if obj is a Margins structure equivalent to the current Margins structure; false otherwise.
member.param: The object to test.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this Margins structure.
member.returns: A value representing the hash code of the Margins structure.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.RemoveFrom(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: This method is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.RotateFlip(System.Drawing.RotateFlipType)
member.summary: This method either rotates, flips, or rotates and flips the Margins structure.
member.param: A RotateFlipType) value indicating the type of rotation and flip to apply to the Margins structure.

member.name: M:Xceed.UI.Margins.Subtract(Xceed.UI.Margins)
member.summary: Subtracts the specified margins from the current Margins structure.
member.param: A Margins structure representing the margins to subtract from the current Margins structure.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.op_Addition
member.summary: Adds the specified Margins structures.
member.returns: A Margins whose value is the sum of margins1 and margins2.
member.param: The first Margins structure to add.
The second Margins structure to add.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.op_Equality
member.summary: Indicates whether two Margins instances are equal.
member.returns: true if the structures are equal; false otherwise.
member.param: The first Margins structure to verify.
The second Margins structure to verify.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.op_Inequality
member.summary: Indicates whether two Margins instances are not equal.
member.returns: true if the structures are not equal; false otherwise.
member.param: The first Margins structure to verify.
The second Margins structure to verify.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.op_Subtraction
member.summary: Subtracts the specified Margins structures.
member.returns: A Margins whose value is the difference between margins1 and margins2.
member.param: The first Margins structure to subtract.
The second Margins structure to subtract.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.Bottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in pixels, of the bottom margin.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the margins are empty.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of the left margin.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.Right
member.summary: Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of the right margin.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.Margins.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in pixels, of the top margin.

member.name: F:Xceed.UI.Margins.Empty
member.summary: Gets an empty Margins structure

member.name: T:Xceed.UI.ThemedContainerControl
member.summary: The ThemedContainerControl class represents an extensible and themable container control for Windows Forms which supports both Windows XP and classic Windows themes and can adapt to the current Windows Theme.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ThemedContainerControl class.

member.summary: Resets the value of the CanSelect property to its default value, DefaultCanSelect.

member.summary: Resets the value of the UIStyle property to its default value.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.ThemedContainerControl.CanSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the ThemedContainerControl can be selected.
member.remarks: This property returns true if the control has ControlStyles.Selectable set to true, is contained in another control, and all its parent controls are both visible and enabled.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.ThemedContainerControl.DefaultCanSelect
member.summary: Gets the default value of the CanSelect property.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.ThemedContainerControl.Properties
member.summary: Gets a collection of property names whose values have been explicitly set as well as the corresponding values.

member.name: P:Xceed.UI.ThemedContainerControl.ResourceAssembly
member.summary: Gets or sets the assembly representing the resource from which the UI style is loaded.
member.remarks: The assembly assigned to the ResourceAssembly property is only taken into consideration when UIStyle is set to ResourceAssembly.

member.summary: This property is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the control/editor.
member.remarks: When set to WindowsXP on non-Windows XP machines, the blue XP theme style will be used. On Windows XP machines, the current theme will be used. member.summary: Raised when the value of the ResourceAssembly property is changed.

member.summary: Clones the specified control.

member.remarks: Events from the source control will not be propagated to the cloned instance.
member.param: A reference to the Control to clone.

member.summary: Copies the values of the properties from the source control to the cloned instance.
member.param: A reference to the Control to clone.
A reference to the cloned control.
The source and destination controls' type.
A string array containing the names of the properties whose values are to be excluded from the cloning process.
A control array containing the child controls who are to be excluded from the cloning process.
